result.execSummary:
The defendant Eboni T Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with any Target Store whatsoever.
Defendant to provide DNA sample if not already done.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - (nonworking hours) Standard release conditions, with Huber for the first 20 days. Last 5 days STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion as well as to huber/straight time. Sentence may be served in Milwaukee County. NO Electronic monitoring.
Serve 50 hours of community service within the next year.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Eboni T Adams in court with attorney Vincent J. Bobot.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 3 dismissed and read-in.

Court orders the following:
Ct. 1:
- 9 months jail straight time STAYED for 1 year Probation - Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County. 
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation:   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No contact with any target stores whatsoever.    Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided.
- Defendant to perform 50 hours of community service within the next year.
 - 25 days jail Condition Time (nonworking hours). 1st 20 days jail with huber condition time (nonworking hours) commencing 05/07/2015.  Non-working hours with standard release conditions. Last 5 days jail  STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion. Sentence may be served in Milwaukee. No Electronic Monitoring if served in Milwaukee.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 1, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Eboni T Adams in court with attorney Vincent J. Bobot.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has received an offer from the State. Defendant needs to complete criminal justice course. Defense requests a date in 2 weeks. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant to have no contact with any co-actors, victim/witnesses/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing
Defendant Eboni T Adams in court with attorney Vincent J. Bobot.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.
